summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 11253, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Evanston Avenue, from Bowdoin Place to North Fiftieth Street; Dayton Avenue, from North Forty-second Street to North Fiftieth Street; Sunset Place, from North Forty-second Street to North Forty-fifth Street; Phinney Avenue, from North Forty-second Street to North Fiftieth Street; North Forty-second Street, from Evanston Avenue to Greenwood Avenue; Greenwood Avenue, from North Forty-second Street to North Forty-third Street, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing water mains or proper dimensions, together with such gates, tees, crosses and other appurtenances as may be necessary for the reasonable water service and fire protection of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 133 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, No. 526, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 said city, approved December 6, 1899."
